instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2251: What is A2251? A2251 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2020 with EMC 3348, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01949..
definitions.820-01949: What is 820-01949? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.065A
threads.message:
I have a  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that had spillage around <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> area <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> had 5v. 
Replaced <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> now getting 20v .065, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.6v .
Any ideas where to look next?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.065A
threads.message:
I would go for DFU.
If not recognized, then check if all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages come on and steady.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.065A
threads.message: I need to keep the data DFu will wipe it?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.065A
threads.message:
DFU Restore will erase SSD.
Try Revive option instead...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.065A
threads.message: It goes into DFu no problem but errors out on revive.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.065A
threads.message:
Which coils get voltage on the board?
Check SSD, RAM and CPU coils...
